intro: Railliardia rockii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Railliardia rockii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
